title: Paranoid
description: “Paranoid” is the opening track to Post Malone’s long-awaited  . He feels as if people could be manipulating him for his fame and fortune and begins taking more precautions to protect himself.

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: Never know when someone comes and tries to take my life
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: Right from the beginning, it becomes clear that it is Post himself who is “paranoid”..45 caliber ammunition is typically used in handguns and pistols. Post raps that he used to sleep with a gun to defend himself from a potential threat, suggesting that he is fearful for his life and security.

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: I've been sleepin' with the .45 like every night
In the whip, I pray to God I don't see flashin' lights
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: Here, “flashing lights” may refer to the red and blue lights from a police cruiser, lights from the cameras used by the paparazzi, or even (since Post mentions praying to God) the stereotypical bright light some who’ve had near-death experiences often report. This ties into other religious themes on beerbongs & bentleys, like on “Over Now” where Post sings:Ain’t religious, only Christian when it’s

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: Goddamn, they right behind me
And I wake up everyday
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: Post has shared that he struggles with anxiety. However, it is typical for ‘creative geniuses’ like Malone to suffer from conditions like anxiety and depression.

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: I wake up every day with this anxiety
And they know where I stay
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: A source of paranoia for Post might stem from an interaction he had with YouTube star Jake Paul. On July 21, 2017, Jake published a video in which he went to Post Malone’s house to hand-deliver merchandise without Post’s approval.

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: Got "Malone" on my plates
And they followin' me
Two hundred bands under the floor of the kitchen
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: Post is stating that people in his life close to him  and many social media haters have been switching up and constantly wanting him to fail. Post said he doesn’t want everyone to think of him being a “rapper” and that he is a artist stating.

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: A little more up in the walls and the ceilin'
Even family and friends started switchin'
Ever since I got that check, seen 'em itchin'
Eyes open, I see you, I'm watchin' you
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: Incorporating the previous two lines, here Post explains that since amassing his fortune and fame people have come out of the woodwork to “befriend” him. He knows better than to fall for this and is skeptical of trusting any of these people who may have ulterior motives for their actions.

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: More people wanna be you, don't trust no one
Tell me why I can get no relief (I can't get no sleep)
Wonderin' when they'll come for me
A paranoid man makes paranoid plans
I do what I can, but it's out of my hands
Strugglin' just to find my peace
Sometimes feel like I got no friends
Can't trust a soul, like I'm Snowden
Right by the bed, keep it loaded
Lord, have mercy if they broke in
I don't ever sleep, yeah, I'm wide awake
If you try to pull up to my place
Beam is gonna hit you a mile away
I promise, one of us gonna die today
Helicopters in the sky
No, he can't escape the eyes
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: Post is referring to the increasingly divided political climate of the United States and with the tensions between political groups being so high, he believes that there is no reason to favor one side over the other as he doesn’t put his trust in any of them.

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: Politicians and the lies
Tell me, what's the point in pickin' sides?
Tell me why I can get no relief (I can't get no sleep)
Wonderin' when they'll come for me
A paranoid man makes paranoid plans
I do what I can, but it's out of my hands
Strugglin' just to find my peace
Ayy, mind is runnin' all day
Cost me more than money and I'm payin' the price, yeah
I ain't goin' nowhere
Killin' myself so I can make me a life, yeah
Minute after minute, never had a limit
Woke up every mornin', knew that I just had to get it
Windows always tinted, you ain't lookin' in it
Either way, I know they'll come for me again
Tell me why I can get no relief (I can't get no sleep)
Wonderin' when they'll come for me
A paranoid man makes paranoid plans
I do what I can, but it's out of my hands
Strugglin' just to find my peace
